I stayed here one Friday night as my usual hotel is often fully booked on the weekends.   The weekends in Sa Pa are currently crazy busy and I highly recommend folks visit Sa Pa Monday to Friday.  Anyway, this is a typical budget hotel the likes of which can be found all over town.  The room was small, without a view, besides the back of the neighboring building. The walk-in rate of 500,000 VND was a bit high in my experience, but it happened to be a busy weekend and I imagine the rates during the week will be a bit less.

Erg goedkoop en zeer behulpzaam en vriendelijk personeel. De gastvrouw heeft me geholpen met een directe minibus naar Sapa.  HygiÃ«ne kan beter, er zat bijvoorbeeld nog een oude bloedvlek op het hoeslaken. Matrassen waren vrij hard. Water was lauw, maar voor mij geen probleem.

What can I possibly say to describe this place?   Well, first of all, I must say that they've obviously spent a ton of money aimed at building a first-class luxurious property. Then, just as obviously, ran out of money before the place was ready for occupancy. More on that later.   The second important feature of this hotel is that it is in the middle of nowhere.   Distance to the nearest food stall, along a desolate and totally unoccupied road: 3 km. To the Lao Cai train station: 8 km. (The  hotel management claims distance to city center: 0.1 km).  To go anywhere, you have to have the front desk call a taxi. (Management claims that there is a shuttle service; there is none).  The two of us, not surprisingly, were evidently the only customers.   Management claims that there is  a restaurant on premises. There is a restaurant building, with tables and chairs all set up for 96 diners. But there is no food whatsoever - they even had to send out to get our breakfast (an excellent pho).  There is even a karaoke bar on the premises, but thankfully, no customers at all, and peacefully silent.   The room we had was nice, but not quite finished. In three places, wiring evidently intended for wall sconces is jutting out of the wall, but no fixtures are installed. At several places, wallpaper is peeling from the wall, but not repaired.  No soap was in the bathroom dispenser.   On the plus side, there was high-pressure hot water, good views, and tastefully decorated rooms. Fast elevator. Lots of electrical outlets. Good AC and fridge. Good selection of channels on the TV. Good high-speed WIFI in the room and lobby.   The few employees on duty seemed genuinely embarrassed by the shortcomings of the place.   To Management, if you read this:  I would return, and maybe other customers would too, if you:       1 .  Cut your prices in half       2.  Provide complimentary shuttle service every half hour to and from the Railway Station      3.  Finish the rooms, and keep them in good repair      4.  Open the restaurant and provide at least a small selection of food for your customers.

In Vietnam, NO room is going to be clean to "Western Standards" unless you start at $250USD per night.  That being said, the Phoung Anh II is about as close as you can get without breaking the bank.  $18USD (350,000Vietnam Dong) gets you a large, clean room with new air-conditioning unit, a small fridge and Wi-Fi.  The owner and her daughter "Tina" (who speaks some English as the kind lady who owns the place does not) go out of their way to assist you with anything - from if your motorbike can handle the ride up the veeerrrry steep hill to the tourist mecca of Sapa (35 Km from Lao Cai) to where is a good place to grab a quick bite in town.  Sleep quality is weak because, whilst the room is veeerrry quite and comfortable, those lovely SouthEast Asian rock-hard mattresses make  life unbearable....but you get used to 'em after a while.....  Located within walking distance to good restaurants, cafes and a quick, five-minute ride to the border gate with China, I strongly recommend this hotel!

We booked a trip to Sapa - Cao Son and Bac Ha with Sapa Travel Expert. This lodge was part of our trip in early 2015. The room itself was basic and not so furnished but fairly fine as we were informed in advance. The food was good and we were invited to join local staff for some drinks too. The area was nice with lush maize plantation and rice paddies.

Mein LÃ¤cheln und xin chau bewirken gar nichts.  Nach 10 Minuten warten, stehe ich auf und frage nach dem Menu. Ich zeige auf zwei Sachen, beides nicht erhÃ¤ltlich. Unwirsch wird mir gezeigt, was es gibt. Ich nicke, bin einverstanden, eine jÃ¼ngere Frau kommt dazu, sie versteht Englisch.  Da ich nach 40 Minuten immer noch kein RÃ¼hrei bekommen habe, gehe ich wieder.   Schade.  Das Lokal sollte dringend aus dem Loose ReisefÃ¼hrer entfernt werden.

TrÃ¨s basique,mais pour 150000 dong que dire de plus. Les chambres sont bruyantes, le mobilier est vieux et pas en bonne Ã©tat, toutes les fenÃªtres sont condamnÃ©s et fuient quand il pleut. La porte terrasse donne sur un mini balcon Ã  partager avec le voisin... Sans parler des odeurs du restaurant. Par conte les lits Ã©taient bon et les draps propres contrairement Ã  son vis Ã  vis trung nguyen !

MalgrÃ© son prix (comptez 12$ pour une nuit dans une chambre avec balcon) cet hÃ´tel est tout simplement horrible : la propretÃ© est inexistante (trous dans les murs, tÃ¢ches jaunes sur les draps, moisissures et j'en passe), le systÃ¨me Ã©lectrique pour l'eau chaude est non fonctionnel (aucune pression et nous avons eu l'eau chaude qu'une seule fois en 2 jours), la petite Ã©tagÃ¨re au dessus du lavabo est prÃªte Ã  tomber, rideaux cache misÃ¨re, les prises ne fonctionnent pas non plus, le balcon ne donne mÃªme pas envie d'y mettre un pied et l'accueil n'est pas trÃ¨s agrÃ©able.. que de petits dÃ©tails mais cela en fait tout de mÃªme beaucoup !! h_title_comment: What do you expect from a 8 dollar room hotel
h_comment: It has a bed, a bathroom, a fan (no airco), warm water, a mini TV and some electricity sockets that work if you plug in your device in a specific angle. Bring earplugs, really: the fan alone can keep godzilla awake. This is the real Vietnam treatment. Not the friendliest service.

The rooms are dated, simple, a bit dusty, but overall fine for a few nights. The staff are hit and miss depending on who you get. English levels vary. Breakfast was bread and eggs of some form, as usual in Vietnam. Very centrally located to get round everywhere.

We booked this place as it was at a convenient stop on our way motorbiking to HCMC. It was hard to find (and incorrectly located on google maps/booking.com which said it was right next to the springs, it is not).   On arriving, it was clear no one in the hotel spoke English. They seemed impatient to usher us to our room a little walk away.   The room was very depressing and smelt damp and unclean. The toilets were pretty filthy and towels very dirty too. We had a hunt for the AC remote as it was sweltering in the room but had to request one from reception, that didn't seem to work. The biggest issue for us were the mosquitoes and because the room was unprotected (nets and uncovered windows) our room was swarming with them. We stayed for around 10 minutes and after being bitten  20-30 times each decided to leave. The hotel staff were not pleased, and it took a good few minutes to rescue our passports before we could go.  Don't waste your money unless you want to be mosquito food.

h_title_comment: Our high hopes of this place were dashed from the first moment we arrived.
h_comment: We booked Long Chau because it was considerably cheaper than the other hostels in Chau Doc and, we foolishly decided, any money we would spend on motos into town, would be saved in the room price. Also, the hotel website promised bicycles to rent and had a restaurant so we felt like we wouldn't need to go to Chau Doc that much anyway.  On our arrival, it became apparent that no one at the hotel spoke English. The moto driver who dropped us off spoke excellent English, waited around while we got checked it and implored the reception staff to help carry my girlfriend's heavy backpack to the room. We were shown to our room which was a basic double with a fan and was quite large.  However, the fan was mounted precariously to the wall opposite the bed and it was on a sweep cycle  which we couldn't switch off. Indeed, in trying to stop the fan's pointless movement, I nearly sliced my finger off. That would have been my fault for being stupid but what is the point in a fan if it just wafts air in every direction apart from the bed.  Furthermore, there was no WiFi in the room. I seem to remember it being advertised on the website as having WiFi but I thought it might have been in public places. We went to the restaurant to try and use it there but were informed they did not have WiFi.  We decided to take advantage of the bicycles the hotel had to offer and ride into town for dinner. We asked if we could rent a bike and got a blank response. After several minutes of acting out bike we were told they had no bikes and that was that. As such, we decided to try and walk the 6km into town, in scorching heat and eventually settled on a cyclo about 1km from the hotel.  The next morning, we breakfasted at the hotel. The menu was basic and we asked for pancakes. 'No pancakes' came the reply. 'Cereal?' We asked, 'no cereal.' All they could offer was bread, jam and butter for $1. Not good. We asked if they could arrange a moto to town and they said yes so imagine our surprise when a taxi arrived. We couldn't argue so we bit the bullet and paid the $3 to town.  After a long day of traipsing around Chau Doc trying to find something to do to kill time, we decided to get an early night as we were getting an early morning boat to Phnom Penh the next day. Unfortunately, when we tried to order dinner at the hotel restaurant, we quickly discovered the only thing they could offer us from the menu (which included steak, fish, pork, seafood, chicken etc) was noodles. Fantastic.  Another expensive taxi to town and back, by now we'd spent well over the money we'd saved, was followed by yet another night of sleeping in a noisy sauna. To top this off, when we arrived back at the hotel at 2045 and the 'Manson Family' seemed reluctant to let us back in.  Our moto driver asked us how we'd found our stay and laughed knowingly when I said awful.

h_title_comment: Nice enough, though a little unloved.
h_comment: It might have been that we were visiting out of season, but the hotel and it's grounds seemed a touch neglected when we visited. The gardens were overgrown, the outdoor bar was full of strewn furniture and the dining hall was deserted. However, as we were leaving, we saw gardeners start to tackle the weeds growing up over the entrance, so it is possible that the neglect that we saw was just due to the time of year.The hotel is very difficult to find, it's 1km down a gravel road in the middle of nowhere, but is very clean and has friendly staff. The rural location is great fun though, especially if you are travelling with a motorbike, as we were. The neighbouring countryside has loads to explore, and there are plenty of local cafes and restaurants nearby. Overall, recommended,  try to get to the hotel at peak season if the appearance of the grounds bothers you.

Since they changed the owner, the service has been better.the staff is so nice and the room is good.I was this hotel in 2 nights and I was enjoy my trip with good price.It just takes 2 mins to go the market because this place is in the centre.thanks for everything! But the hotel need to update new pictures.it seems now the hotel look better and new!

A boy with moto meet me at the hotel when I arived with bus in the city I was a stupid usually I use trip advisor for my hotel. The hotel is no clean, no wifi you have to connect to the near hotels and the morning I hade to pay ten dollar and not 200000 dong as written on the wall, I have been in Vietnam one month it's the first time I think a hotel give me less than I pay

h_title_comment: Never seen a so bad and dirty Hotel
h_comment: We had a one month stay in Vietnam. The Tai Ngan Hotel was the worst hotel we had during our stay. We strongly recommend you not to choose this hotel. It is very dirty, there are little rats sh... on the bed !!! The balconey is full of moskitos. Further, the staff is impolite and not fair.

My friend and me actually wanted to stay in Thuan Loi Hotel, the one floating in the river. However, after we realised that it is full, we accepted a free motorbike ride from the owner of that floating inn to this alternative hotel.   We arenâ€™t willing to pay the same price for it though, because itâ€™s a different hotel without the river views after all. Eventually, we were quoted a lower price and the boss, who already seemed unhappy with this haggling, started selling a boat border crossing to Cambodia to us. We had planned on doing a land crossing so we adamantly refused their offers again. Then he claimed that no land crossing can be arranged from Chau Doc, which I donâ€™t believe for a second. By this point, even the hotel receptionist who spoke English seemed black faced as  well.   When we finally reached our room after navigating a staircase in darkness, we realised that though our room was big, it was sort of in disrepair. Amazingly, the receptionistâ€™s attitude changed 180 degrees during the rest of our stay in the hotel. She actually smiled at us on our way down to dinner! Leading us to seriously consider the possibility of her renegading on the price we agreed on when we had to check out the next day.   The location of the hotel was good, with lots of street food around to savour and just a short walk to the riverside. Asking around, we managed to book a land crossing from the receptionist at the nearby Hotel Hai Chau. Although we checked out of our hotel without incident the next morning, I believe that there are better places to stay out there for the same price. The stress and aggravation that we had to endure when we havenâ€™t even checked in is uncalled for, though the magical change in the receptionistâ€™s attitude during the rest of our stay earned that 2nd star from me.

Die Rezeptionistin fragte mich sofort was ich mache und als ich sagte das ich mit dem Motorrad nach Kambodscha fahre wurde ich gleich angelogen denn sie sagte das es nicht erlaubt sei mit dem Motorrad Ã¼ber die Grenze zu fahren.Sie versuchte mich dann zu Ã¼berreden eine Schifffahrt nach Phnom Penh bei ihr zu buchen.Ich fragte sie warum sie lÃ¼gt doch sie grinste mich an und sagte das ist keine lÃ¼ge.vor dem Hotel hat mich dann ein Mann der schon gewartet hatte versucht mir den Motorroller billigst abzukaufen da ich damit ja nicht weiterreisen kann.Ich sagte nein und fuhr dann etwa 3 Kilometer weit zu eine Restaurant und plÃ¶tzlich stand der Mann, der mich offensichtlich verfolgt hat wieder neben mir und versuchte es weiter mit mir zu handeln doch ich sagte wieder nein und fragte  warum er mich verfolgt doch er sagte er will mir nur helfen.Am Tag der Abreise  verrÃ¤ppelte mich die Rezeptionistin die ganze Zeit indem sie mir pausenlos lÃ¤cherlichste Angebote fÃ¼r den Roller machte obwohl ich betonte das ich ihn sicher nicht verkaufe und sie fÃ¼r verlogen und hinterhÃ¤ltig halte zur Sicherheit verlangte ich eine Rechnung Ã¼ber das bezahlte Zimmer den  vertrauen kann man in dem Hotel niemanden.Sich als Gast so behandeln zu lassen bei dem Zimmerpreis ist eine Frechheit und in Europa wÃ¤re sie bei dem benehmen lÃ¤ngst gekÃ¼ndigt. Es gibt andere Hotels wo man mit Respekt behandelt wird aber hier nicht und im Gegenteil man muss sogar noch aufpassen nicht betrogen zu werden.Diese Zeilen schreibe ich aus Kambodscha wo ich problemlos mit dem Motorrad einreisen konnte.

h_title_comment: has obviously improved in the last two years.
h_comment: Ended up here after an awful night at the hotel our moto driver 'recommend' (we knew that would be a mistake!) and, without wifi, took to checking a few out. We paid 290,000 dong for a really nice twin room. It was nice and clean, aircon, fridge, tv, bathroom were all great. Added bonus: small balcony overlooking the main square, good for people watching and getting washing dry overnight. The wonderfully friendly couple who run the shop/bookshop helped us book the bus for our next stop, and i later read online others recommending a local tour from him. All in all, a happy accident stay for us, and would easily recommend hotel sao song to others. My guess is that management and standards have changed since last reviews. Ps - yes, the early morning bells were annoying for a few  minutes, but we went straight back to sleep for a couple more blissful hours sleep. No other sounds woke us up

h_title_comment: Not my cup of tea but cheap as chips
h_comment: Location is nice upon first impression as it overlooks the town square, close to everything. However at 4am loud Public Announcements start followed by music at 5am, not for the weary traveller. Beds are very hard, linen very poor but clean. Airconditioning worked well. Bathroom basic and worn. Staff friendly but very limited english, hard to communicate. For those on a budget, excellent value! It's ok, but not for me.

We stayed at the Song Sao Hotel in Chau Doc and were very dissapointed, despite it being central and only $15 per night.   The plus's was it's central location and that it has a lift. The negatives were that they suggested the price included breakfast, but when we wnet to pay pointed out the fine print which showed it was U$4 more. Then they just smiled at you. The breakfast was crap and certainly not worth the money. Our room was also dirty and infested with ants whcih got into our bags. Overall the place needs a makeover and wasn't good value and the staff were dishonest.  You can do better. On a postive note we would definately agree with another reviewer that the old couple running the breakfast place/bookshop/ticket ofice next door were lovely and we booked our boat trip  through then to Phnom penh.

I wasn't sure what to expect but I wasn't expecting much considering it was kinda off the beaten track..not many tourists go to Cao Son. And you can see from the pictures you aren't gonna be getting 5 star nor even 3 star accomodations. (the word ECOlodge probably gives you a big clue).  So I was surprised when I saw my room. It was rather huge and I didn't get dark, dinghy, mouldy, drafty, maybe even a bit dirty rooms/toilet. And I was the only guest there, so I got a LOT of privacy. In fact since I was travelling alone, I did imagine funny stuff on a particularly rainy, thunder and lightning night. But it was just imagination, if anything was scary, it was how insects seem to manage to get into your room overnight. You'll wake up with moths and other unidentifiable insects in

I ended up at the Ky An at 8pm on a Saturday night when I was unable to find any other available room anywhere in the town. I was beginning to panic, thinking that I would be spending the night out on the street, a thought which as I, a female, solo traveling, mobility handicapped, senior did not relish.  I took the first room available and it was the Ky An's last room, having tried at least a dozen other places first.  The Ky An is just around the corner from the bus station. I was woefully overcharged, $30 for a room which was not worth any more than $10 maximum.  The room was large, had 3 beds in it, but no sheets on the bed. There was no hot water. The rate did not include breakfast, and the place was very loud. It seemed as if every noise amplifying building material and  technique has been used in its construction. The lobby was used as a garage for their cars.  Avoid the Ky An if at all possible.

h_title_comment: Do not advice you to go here!
h_comment: I arrived late afternoon after a long day of traveling. I had to check in, but soon I found out nobody speaks English.. It is also far away from Chau Doc, I should have checked better when i booked through Agoda... The room is super small and not clean. When I checked the bathroom the floor was wet and the toilet seat up.. The pillow smelt like someone just slept there and there where hairs on the floar. The window did not close properly and it is a very noisy area with lots of buses and cars.. so I couldn't really sleep.. Also the air conditioning made a strange sound.. When I wanted to order some dinner, it was just impossible, I am vegetarian and tried my best with google translate when they send a guy to my room to ask what I wanted.. first there was food then there was only  breakfast... later a woman comes with  a phone so I could talk to someone who speaks English, suddenly I could order food, but it was after nine, and I already ate some fruit and chips I had left.. This hotel is just not made for foreigners in my opinion.. I paid $23 for this... NO GOOD!!! Ow and the wifi is also very poor...

We booked this hotel through Booking.com when it was called Satisfy hotel,  for two nights as part of a 14 night holiday in Vietnam and Cambodia.   Before moving to Chau Doc we checked the web site and found that Booking.com were no longer taking bookings so rang them to check why.  They said they would contact the hotel and did not but in the meantime we realised that this hotel was one and the same and was advertised on Booking.com.   I rang back, told them what I had found out and they again said they would get back to me and this time they said it was under new ownership who would honour previous bookings.  However on arrival the manager? did not speak any English, could not seem to find our booking but showed us to a room with a balcony and view of a tin roof.  I managed to  mime that we had ordered a view of the pool and this time were taken to a room with a view but no balcony.  More miming and we finally got the room we had ordered.  Later realised we were the only people staying there.    Room ok although it could do with a new lick of paint. No sign of any breakfast or the advertised bicycles.  The restaurant was never open, the room was not cleaned or towels changed even though there seemed to be lots of staff with nothing to do.  I had to take an empty toilet roll to communicate we needed more. A cafe open at the front of the restaurant was moderately busy but we did not use it.

Hotel was located far from the city centre which was not convenient. Room was clean but noisy. We woke up at around 5am because of the noise outside. Breakfast not included. Staff was helpful but did not speak a word of English which made the conversation really difficult. We had a few racists experiences in chau doc:people did not want to sell us some bus tickets as we were "white", some restaurants refused to serve another couple of tourists. Not nice atmosphere for tourists.

h_title_comment: You get what you pay for ;-)
h_comment: This hotel is probably one of the budget options in Chau Doc so don't expect too much. Although it's a bit run down it's a good place to stay for one or two nights. The cheapest room didn't have a window so I decided to pay little extra and got a nice room with a balcony.  Have seen places which are more clean but it was still ok.  Staff was really friendly until they found out that I booked my boat ticket at another place. After that they got really grumpy. So better don't tell them if you book your ticket anywhere else ;-)

h_title_comment: Decent budget choice, but be wary
h_comment: Arrived here by walking from the dock, after taking the speedboat from Phnom Penh. The room is not exactly sparkling clean, and quite hot due to a fairly poorly located fan. Polyester bed sheets are mind-bogglingly bad: who came up with that idea?!  However, for $10 a night we got two double beds, TV, fridge, hot water and a shared balcony. Wifi is reasonable and the owner friendly and with a good grasp of English. We did peek inside some other rooms and they looked significantly worse - I'd definitely pay extra for one at the front.  We wanted to move on to Can Tho, and the hotel offered us a bus ticket with transfers for 8$. Now, we know the bus fair is closer to 5$ so decided to go to the bus station and take care of it ourselves. The hotel owner offered us a moto for $1.50,

SituÃ© Ã  7 km de Chau- Doc, Le Van Huong Mai Resort implantÃ© dans un Parc d'attraction aurait pu Ãªtre un endroit agrÃ©able mais il n'en est rien... A bien y regarder, tout est dÃ©fraichi, mal entretenu et les chambres de l'hÃ´tel tout simplement insalubres. Si l'hÃ´tel n'est pas cher, on peut tout de mÃªme s'attendre Ã  des prestations minimales mais il n'en est rien: pas de draps sur le lit et juste une couverture douteuse, pas d'eau chaude, une fuite au plafond de la salle de bains qui ne doit pas Ãªtre rÃ©cente et la rend humide et insalubre, des fils dÃ©nudÃ©s sous la table de nuit et une porte dont le verrou ne cesse de tomber...Que dire de plus, sinon que c'est purement scandaleux qu'un tel hÃ´tel continue Ã   figurer sur des sites ayant pignon sur rue comme Agoda.   Le Manager du Van  Huong Mai Resort, Monsieur Minh, prÃ©sentÃ© pourtant par certains avis comme un directeur charmant, nous a confisquÃ© nos passeports dÃ¨s le premier soir, prÃ©textant un contrÃ´le de police et ne nous les a rendus que le dernier jour malgrÃ¨ nos vives protestations.  L'hÃ´tel Ã©tant loin de Chau-Doc et un taxi aller-retour plusieurs fois par jour coÃ»tant un peu cher, nous avons Ã©tÃ© contraints de dÃ®ner sur place: une nourriture quelconque dans un endroit oÃ¹ nous Ã©tions visiblement les seuls clients.  Autre exemple, le petit dÃ©jeuner que nous avions payÃ© d'avance Ã©tait rationnÃ© et frugal; si vous aviez le malheur de demander une seconde tasse de cafÃ©, c'Ã©tait un supplÃ©ment; idem pour l'eau ou le pain...  Enfin, nous avons eu la pÃ©nible impression d'Ãªtre sans cesse Ã©piÃ©s par Monsieur Minh; ainsi lors d'une excursion au" Mont Sam" bookÃ©e avec l'hÃ´tel, Mr Minh n'a pas arrÃªtÃ© d'appeler le chauffeur pour savoir ce que nous faisions jouant "les Big Brother"!  Pour finir, si je dois vous donner un conseil, passez votre chemin et prÃ©fÃ©rez vous installer dans un hÃ´tel  au centre de Chau-Doc...  PS: Pour appuyer la crÃ©dibilitÃ© de ma critique, j'y joins quelques photos.

Un cauchemar : " lâ€™hÃ´tel " est situÃ© Ã  6km de la ville le long de la route nationale (10 $ aller-retour), loin de tous commerces, nous voilÃ  donc coincÃ©s dans un endroit oÃ¹ seul le gÃ©rant parle un peu l'anglais. Les chambres sont laides et mal entretenues (traces d'urine sur la cuvette des WC), il n'y a PAS DE DRAP dans les lits, juste une couverture Ã  la propretÃ© douteuse. Pas d'eau chaude dans les douches, des traces au mur, une fuite dans la salle de bain, c'est l'horreur ! Le gÃ©rant profite de notre isolement pour nous dÃ©lester de tout l'argent possible : faire payer la piscine normalement comprise dans le prix, un supplÃ©ment pour une deuxiÃ¨me tasse de cafÃ© au petit dÃ©jeuner, des places de bus supplÃ©mentaires pour les bagages, et garde nos passeports tant que nous n'avons  pas rÃ©glÃ© ces supplÃ©ments. Le parc est vÃ©tuste, les attractions n'offrent aucune sÃ©curitÃ© et tout est payant. Le petit dÃ©jeuner ne se compose que d'une boisson et d'un plat (Å“uf ou pain) le tout d'une qualitÃ© trÃ¨s mÃ©diocre (cafÃ© imbuvable, pas de beurre). La nourriture proposÃ©e au restaurant n'est d'ailleurs pas bonne non plus. Je prÃ©cise que tous mes dires sont vÃ©ridiques et attestÃ©s par des photos que je poste sur Tripadvisor. La ville de Chau Doc offrant peu d'intÃ©rÃªt je vous conseille de choisir un hÃ´tel central et d'y rester le moins longtemps possible. Pour nous ce fut le pire moment de nos vacances !

This was definately not what we wrre ecpexting when wr arrived.  This place is like a sunny butlins equipped with a pool with slides, bumper cars and family fun.  It also had a good restaurant, immaculately clean rooms, a promt laundry service and daily fresh fruit.  The manager was very helpful organising tours to any spec.  However, transport us much cheaper if ypu organise it yourself.  After a few swesty days in non air con rooms that erre dirty, this place wss a welcome relief.

We booked this relatively inexpensive clean and  modern hotel for family travelling with us. It is about 3 years old. There is a courtyard area at the front with steps up to reception area. The bedrooms are upstairs via lift or stairs being nicely furnished with wooden beds and ensuite bathrooms.It is family run and friendly - the elder son speaks some English. No breakfast provided but pho can be bought outside. It is a good location for temples (200 metres) and local shops for drinks and fruit. For a stopover fine.

ho soggiornato solo una notte dovendomi fermare ho guardato in internet e ho preso la guesthouse piÃ¹ econimica, un letto pulito , un bagno, internet, tutto quello che mi serviva. personale disponibile e di aiuto

I was just there for one night on my way to Cambodia (by the Hang Chau boat the next morning) from HCM City, and so there was a pickup shuttle (thanks to the hotel manager who told me that in advance :) ) and it was just about a ten minute ride to the hotel (I was the first to be dropped off).  The lady at the desk called the Hang Chau boat office right away to confirm my pickup for the next morning, so that was very, very nice of them! :)  And, the staff also made sure that I was up the next morning by coming to knock on my door and all that, so yes very impressed with their hospitality service :).  Was picked up by a foot-pedalled richshaw in the morning and got to the boat dock in just like 20 minutes.  There's a noodle/soup restaurant like right beside the hotel turning left  towards the main road after getting out of the hotel (the restaurant is right on the corner but you have to enter it from the main road), and you get to the Bassac River (there may be another name for it too) by turning left again onto the main road and walking about ten minutes, and there are quite a few places to eat along that main road as well like places for rice meals which you can't get at the noodle/soup place beside the hotel.  About the only downside was the TV reception, but then there really wasn't much time to watch TV anyway since I had to be up at like 5 45 am :).

Un chambre bon marchÃ© pour partir le lendemain direction Phnom Penh, mais rien d'autre. Les propriÃ©taires sont souriants et ont pu m'aider Ã  booker le trajet vers le Cambodge, malgrÃ© leur niveau d'anglais et la chambre Ã©tait propre avec un bon wifi, mais Ã  part Ã§a, c'est excentrÃ© et bruyant Ã  cause de divers karaokÃ©s dans le coin.

h_title_comment: Good for one night in a border town, but not any longer...
h_comment: Vy Khanh was a bit of a walk from the waterfront. Since we would only be here for one night before catching the boat to Phnom Penh the following day, I didn't want to spend much on a room. We paid $10. It was a fine room for one night, but definitely had a musty/smoky odor. The best part about this guest house was the excellent wifi.  Karaoke is big here and you could definitely hear some people singing into the night, but not a big deal.

h_title_comment: An out of the way gem
h_comment: This hotel is reviewed in guide books under the name Delta Adventure Inn, but trying to locate it on the ground under this name is next to impossible.  Locally it goes by the name of Long Chau Resort.  It is out of Chau Doc, almost at the Sam Mountain settlement, and is set far enough back off the road to be away from traffic noise. The large restaurant is open on all sides, behind this is a lake with a pretty island, around which are approx 20 single story "cottages". The rooms are basic, but perfectly adequate, the beds are  comfortable, and the water is hot.  Breakfast is included in the room price, which ranges from 130,000 Dong to 240,000Dong. My room was in the middle at 180,000 Dong (16,000 dong to 1 US$)  I looked out onto rice paddys from the side window and onto the

h_title_comment: Feel At Home Above The Clouds And Under The Stars With Flower Hwong Neighbours
h_comment: Everything was well organised. Our guide was funny, Dan his name. Walking to Cao Son Ecolodge was the best way to get in touch with the surrounding. My 2 and a half year old son, Stewart was walking on his own a fair bit! Picking up stones and sticks along the way follow by many questions from him about things he sees such as pigs, chicks, buffalos, ponies and a snake. Every little village have a school. Many children are shy but curious. I really loved the Flower Hwong tribe. They are so friendly and one time I was invited to have tea in their humble wood house with mud walls. Eventhough we could not speak each other language but we tried to understand each other by hand gestures. We share a few words from each other at the end. Meals at Ecolodge was typical local dishes with

h_title_comment: Cozy home far from home in the mountain Vietnam
h_comment: Our trip to Cao Son was one of the most successful holiday that we have got. The lodge was not quite big yet it offers beautiful small garden, large ground with some interact with local people. We enjoyed much the scene of Flower Hmong woman taking their buffaloes to the farm.  Mr Tan, the cook did his job perfect for some delicious Asian dishes. Moreover, we love the trek to Tin Thang and Lapantan forest. The view from Lapantan was awesome from Lapantan to Lao Cai mountain range.  There are something impressive about the lodge is the musical performance and the rite of the " village healer".  Shortly, I would alway recommend this place to all travelers who are keen on explore something unique and special in the mountain of Vietnam

Een ok hotel om te verblijven. We hebben dit hotel gekozen om de ligging. Treinstation is niet heel ver hier vandaan en vanuit de locatie is het makkelijker meerdere locaties in de omgeving te bezoeken zoals sa pa en Bac ha. Qua ligging wel aan te raden als je meer dan alleen sa pa wilt bezoeken. Wat erg jammer was is dat ze werkelijk geen woord Engels spreken, maar met gebaren kom je een heel eind. De medewerkers waren zeer vriendelijk. Zonder kosten kregen we een zeer late check out en de kamer faciliteiten waren over t algemeen in orde alles wat nodig is was aanwezig. Behalve de badkamer we hadden namelijk geen warm water. Waarschijnlijk hadden we net pech omdat het stuk was. Het was gelukkig erg warm weer dus n koele douche was niet zo erg.

h_title_comment: Good location but rip off bus prices
h_comment: We stayed here for two nights as we could not get a connecting bus to Ha Tien. The rooms were clean and decent bathrooms. There was a TV in the room but the plug was broken. The restaurant had some good choices at reasonable price, overall it was a pleasant stay. The location is great, with all amenities very close by.  However, when we asked for bus prices to Ha Tien, we were quoted $8 which is ridiculously expensive. We managed to get a ticket for $3, so I do not suggest booking anything using the tour desk here. The receptionist also appeared very annoyed that we did not book with her despite the ridiculous price.

Staff here were very friendly and helpful. We were part of a large group. They were very accommodating. The location is very central, one street away from the local markets, plus there is quite a few decent eating places within walking distance. For budget accommodation on your way to somewhere else it was very adequate.

We stayed one night during Mekong Delta -tour, but never again. Street-side-room was quite clean with  out-off-date furnitures and one sheet to lie on, poor bathroom. Breakfast-menu was normal, but omelet was not cooked well and  juice was finished. Breakfast service was slow. We can recommend in emergency for very short stay.

Petit hotel tres frequente notamment par les tours provenant de Saigon ou Phnom Penh. Pour les voyageurs independants il y a tout de meme quelques chambres a bas prix (7 USD la double). Cependant il n'y a pas de fenetres mais une sorte d'ouverture avec des barres en beton et sans moustiquaire. Pas de soucis pour ce qui est du froid mais par contre les moustiques !!! Petit restaurant en bas, pas tres bon rapport qualite prix et en plus il y a de nombreux pousse-pousse en bas qui passent la soiree a vous proposer d'aller faire un tour, ca va 5 mn mais au bout de 2h !!!

siamo arrivati in questo albergo con il tour del Mekong. Albergo situato nella zona del mercato. le stanze hanno due letti molto grandi ma la stanza era molto sporca. Il personale non parla inglese. La mattina al momento del check out l'addetta Ã¨ stata molto scortese per dieci minuti di ritardo al momento della richiesta dei passaporti li ha consegnati molto sgarbatamente. La wifi al terzo piano non funzionava almeno nella nostra stanza la 301. Colazione minima. Stanza economica. Struttura non consigliata.

h_title_comment: Not bad for a short stay
h_comment: Clean and spacious room with fan and AC. Beds were big and good.  The hot shower didn't work but it was so hot that we didn't mind the cold water.   Only one person from the staff speaks good English, but she's usually not there. With the rest it was rather difficult to communicate. They were friendly and helpful though.   Breakfast was not that good but there are not may options in the area so you might as well have it.   We stayed for two nights and can't really complain, though being it so cheap, you get what you pay for.

very clean room, very cheap. also the food is very good.  not far from the centre of chau doc.  very good staff willing toi help you, very well organised for doing trips.  would go back ther if ur travelling on budget.

h_title_comment: Well, it was cheap, I'll give it that
h_comment: With cheapness came filth, dusty airs and a non functionin air conditioning, but then you can't expect a lot from such a place. In true Vietnamese tradition, the folks outside honked their car horns a lot and the window's didn't have any sound isolation, which wasn't good for sleep. The staff wasn't very helpful and seemed even rude at times. We reserved this hotel through the same company that we bought a Mekong Delta cruise from and not knowing anything about it, we caved into the cyclo sellers at the harbour who then scooted us the massive 200 metre distance to the hotel :D  Vinh Phuoc's "restaurant" food (more like a lobby kiosk) wasn't anything to write home about either. Many of the dishes on their menu weren't actually available and what we did get was very simple

Es gibt Zimmer nur mit Ventilator und solche mit AC zusÃ¤tzlich (die Fernbedienung fÃ¼r die Klimaanlage bekommt man beim Einchecken), die Air Condition in unserem Zimmer allerdings ziemlich altersschwach, Ventilator war die ganze Nacht erforderlich. Part of a Mekong Delta/ Cambodia trip. Stayed in many Vietnam hotels but this was one of the worst- but what do you expect on a low budget package tour?

room single at 6$, bargained 5$: clean, double bed, tv, water as extra, towels, toothbrush, toilet paper, soap, attached bathroom / western toilet / hot shower, bucket, free wifi but only at reception/restaurant (still, other networks visible on 3F), small "window", tours/bus/map of city available.  The bus/boat trip from Phnom Penh by Mekong tour arrives here and after a quick tour of a few hotels, it is right in budget range.

h_title_comment: Just plain blah - had to stay there because of tour
h_comment: Another hotel I had to stay as part of Mekong delta tour.  Thankfully this one has balcony so we managed to have plenty supply of air in in such a hot climate in this area.  No frills but seriously if you are on budget and fancy nothing, this is decent enough. Don't know about the value-for-money though. Like I said, stayed there because its arranged by tour.

Stayed here one night on my way to Cambodia. unfriendly staff, rooms not clean...overall not a nice stay, if you can avoid it..although it could be difficult especially if you have bought a 3 days trip on the Mekong...it's part of the deal.

h_title_comment: dont stay there,only if you dont have an alternative!
h_comment: really dont stay there, for 10 usd/ night you should find something else!!   rooms are very poor, the windows doesnt close very good and you get a lot of noise all night long!   at 4 am they open the local pub next to the hotel and you ll listen a lot of vietmamese people talking.... at 4(four) in the morning!!!   really it was terrible!

h_title_comment: Don't stay here if you don't have to
h_comment: We didn't pick this hotel ourselves as it was included as part of a travel package.  I assume we had the cheapest rooms but even so it was a real disapointment.   The room was small, very very dated with nasty polyester sheets on the beds.   The fan barely worked and as the windows did not open the heat became unbearable over the course of the night.   The staff really couldn't be bothered to help. They spent all their time on the Internet hardly able to look away from it when curtly answering questions  After breakfast I used the bathroom in reception. This was accessed through a pretty ditrty looking kitchen.    I didn't enjoy my stay here one bit.

DO NOT STAY HERE! We stayed here as part of a tour from Cambodia to Vietnam. We did not choose the hotel and like everyone else on the trip got put into this dirty excuse for a hotel. There were flies and bugs everywhere like a plague. The rooms barely fit a bed in, the bed was dirty and the matress had springs comming out of the middle. The walls, floor and bathroom were black with dirt. The windows were two slits in the wall with no netting to stop things comming in. We ate here and the chicken came raw, and the pork with rice had an elastic band in the middle. We complained along with almost every other guest and the staff basically said tough. Book your own accommodation if doing the border crossing, even if it means paying more, at least you won't wake up with food

We booked tickets from Phnom penh to Phu Quoc Island with one overnight in Chau Doc. The Vinh Phuoc hotel was included. We found it a quite depressive place to stay. The entrance was very dirty, you had to clime a lot of stairs with your luggage to enter the depressive room with a lot of street noise, sheets with burning marks,  The bathroom was the only place that was allright.

h_title_comment: Tried to rob everyone who walked through the door
h_comment: Rude and ignorant staff , they tried to overcharge us for the boat to cambodia and got a right strop on when we questoined the price , also tried to overcharge us for dinner as did the two tables around us , we've been to Vietnam twice now and these jokers are  the worst  we've ever come across in a land of lovely people, a really helpful bookshop, money exchange , breakfast bar and ticket bookers is located next to the Song Sao hotel run by an older couple couldn't be reccomended highly enough.

h_title_comment: Clean budget accommodation in Chau Doc, Vietnam
h_comment: Another clean and tidy one star hotel on our 3 day Mekong Delta tour from Saigon. Not an ounce of luxury hotel, but it is cheap and cheerful with friendly staff.  Our twin room consisted of 2 x double and 1 x single bed, satellite tv that had no sound, chair, bedside table and wardrobe. Window in room looked out on a wall of another building and door to the small dark balcony was locked shut. Cooling was by way of a wall fan. Air conditioning is in the room and if wanted, an extra US$5 will get you the key to the power switch for it. A small bathroom with hand basin, toilet and shower that sprays into the room making the floor and toilet wet. Towels are provided, but take your own soap as we did, because it isnâ€™t supplied here. Beds are typically as we found in Vietnam and with

Aucune de nos tentatives pour communiquer avec la proprio fut fructueuse, elle n'Ã©tait pas en mesure de nous donner un plan de la ville ou une info pratique, on avait vraiment l'impression de la dÃ©ranger... Pour 200 000 VND la chambre double, vous pouvez sans doute trouver mieux dans les alentours oÃ¹ nous avons aperÃ§u  quelques guesthouses.

h_title_comment: Nothing resort-ish in this hotel - just a local bush!
h_comment: I've just visited this hotel as mistakenly thought this one is the V Resort (which is actually located in Kim Boi, outside Hoa Binh City) -- the name is so confusing...  This V Star Resort is a local would-be-resort, but actually nothing more than a bush, a muddy stream, and run down rooms and facilities. It's almost like a local park bungalow.  I visited this place on Sunday. This hotel has a swimming pool, but it was full of local kids, so I was afraid that it'd come with a lot of pees in the water... I was not brave enough to jump in...  Anyway, I could not find any reason to choose this would-be local resort as there are several better options in Hoa Binh City. This place is not even relaxing than urban hotels. Avoid.

This is situated in quite a remote part of the country so you have to expect limitations. The grounds are lovely and our room was fine, warm with comfy beds, clean, with tea and coffee making facilities and plenty of hot water. The reception area was very cold. Admittedly the outside temperature was not high but they had all the doors open. Wifi  only worked in the corridors. The dining room, which was also freezing cold, was a  5 minute walk away from the main building so if you are likely to encounter rain you will need waterproofs to get there. Dinner was good, varied selection and tasty. Sadly breakfast was poor. Extremely limited choice even for us- we normally  have fruit, bread and jam. They ran out of mango on the first day and on both days there was only one type of  bread and jam available. The indoor swimming pool was very warm the first night but less warm, but still OK on the second night.  Location is good for venturing into the surrounding area but don't expect too much from your stay.

h_name: KhÃ¡ch Sáº¡n TrÆ°á»ng ThÃ nh HNA
h_comment: This was my first visit to Hai Duong to see friends I had met in Ha Noi. The hotel is centrally located. Very friendly staff. Unfortunately, no one spoke English, and they did not have my reservation listed from Buy.com, so it took awhile to convince them that I did indeed have a reservation. The room was nice, but the internet did not work. The staff was very quick to remedy the situation.  Very nice hotel lobby and bar. Amazingly.. empty except for four English teachers I had met several years ago in Ha Noi and myself. The restaurant was also deserted when I went to each lunch at 12:30 PM. That evening I hosted the four English teachers and the family of one student at the Chinese restaurant. Here, the food and the service was truly outstanding. It is also centrally located  near avery lovely pond complete with paddle boats shaped like ducks and swans. There are also several international restaurants located around the lake. I will definitely return the next time I am in Hai Duong!

h_name: KhÃ¡ch Sáº¡n TrÆ°á»ng ThÃ nh HNA
h_title_comment: 4 stars hotel without 24h a la carte menu
h_comment: I did not stay at The Great Wall Hotel, but as it is advertise as a 4 stars hotel and as i am living in Hai Duong for more than 17 years, i wanted to check if they do have, as a 4 stars hotel need to have, a "a la carte menu" available 24h/day in the restaurant. I just make a phone call, and learn that the kitchen closed at 9PM only ... i was so disappointed ... i did review the Hotel Classification on Wikipedia and found that a 4 stars hotel need to have an "a la carte menu" available at the restaurant, but not always available to the room... but it seems that even in the restaurant, nothing is available... despite that, the guy who answer me was quite helpful and good English speaking, he apologize a lot for this misbehavior of the hotel and invited me to come during day time.

h_title_comment: Across the road from the Lake in HAI Duong
h_comment: We had to pay for a 'VIP' room(about $60) to get a bed that wasn't just an ensemble base without any padding(they don't use mattresses ((which seems to be the norm in Vietnam)) Helpful staff, pleasant rooms & the VIP rooms come with  massive windows with views of the lake. Showers no good for people over 5'5'. Buffet Breakfast 99% Asian food & Tang is served as Orange Juice. Wouldn't return unless discounted. Ok but not great.

En terrasse de l'hÃ´tel restauration rapide..bonne surprise avec un cari de poulet( chaud,copieux et bien cuisine servi en cocotte) et un phá»‘ ( soupe vietnamienne) au bÅ“uf prÃ©parÃ© Ã  2 pas dans des l9caux flambant neuf. Personnel souriant Ã©t bilingue

After staying in 2 hotels in Vietnam (and been on a Halong Bay cruise) where all of the staff were so friendly and smiling, we were "greeted" by probably the only front of house staff in Asia who have zero customer facing skills. At first it seemed as if there was a problem with our booking and then the reception staff hardly acknowledged us.  The room was large, we had 2 double beds pushed together, but I wouldn't say "spotless" as there were some sunflower seeds on the floor under the desk.  Breakfast was terrible, we had paid for 5 nights breakfast but only ate on the 1st morning choosing to eat elsewhere instead.  There were virtually no staff in the breakfast area, apart from a guy making noodles and fried eggs. At 8am (breakfast from 6.30 -> 9.00) most of the items were  empty. There were dirty cups, plates etc on trolleys in the eating area. We witnessed one guest ask for a cup for coffee and she was dismissively pointed to glasses.  I have never been in a hotel where they asked for a deposit for the room key card (which I had to remind them off at the end of the stay) or where we were asked to remain in reception while they checked the mini bar when we checked out.  The location is great, at quieter end of the "strip"of bars / restaurants, and about 15min stroll to Cat Co (beach 3), which we loved.  The view over the sea/bay we had was amazing.  This was the most expensive hotel we stayed in in Vietnam, including the Oriental Jade in Hanoi, which is a completely different level of hotel, and the difference between the customer service there and here was like night and day.

No one was there to check us in, and when they finally showed up they were unwelcoming.  Room was clean but there were dirty towels in the toilet, and problems with the shower and the toilet seat. When we opened the window we found smoked cigarettes in there. The double- bed in the room was really two single beds connected with a hard wooden bar. While in most hotels mentioning your room number is enough for getting breakfast, here they almost wouldnâ€™t let us in because we lost our silly paper voucher we received during check in. In short- unprofessional staff and disappointing accommodation experience.  .

Hotel looks new with no sign of ageing anywhere. Only reason for giving it 4 is the room size and sleep comfort. Everything else is ordinary. Pros : Big room size with window Bath tub Next to restaurants Condom is provided in room just in case you miss In room mini bar Clean linen and towels  Cons: Only cash hotel No wifi Restaurant is there but not operational Non English speaking staff Room AC temperature cannot be controlled. I was literally sweating Found undergarments of previous guests in almirah No hand soap provided  Expensive room rent compared to services recieved

what can I say it was like faulty towers but worse . no English speaking staff . same breakfast every morning . westerners not catered for at all .  can see that spent loads of money on the place .. but food failed miserably every time . & getting charged more for what the guy outside quoted us for & got the cheek to charge xtra 3%for using card .  room was very satisfactory.  be carefully guys

h_title_comment: Voldeed niet aan onze verwachting! Mega gehorig.
h_comment: Wij spenderen onze laatste 4 dagen in Vietnam in het Paradise hotel in Cat Ba. We hoopten op een relaxte afsluiting met strand en zwembad. Helaas is dit niet het geval. Het zwembad op de rooftop is erg mooi, maar slechts geopend van 07.00 am tot en met 08.30 am en van 16.00 pm tot en met 18.30 pm, heel apart!!!! Daarnaast zijn er erg veel toeristen uit eigen land, die enorm veel lawaai maken op de gang en het gehele hotel overnamen. We zijn enkele keren om 05.00 am uit ons bed gegild, of voor de grap werd er bij ons aangebeld (nogal asociaal)! Wellicht dat het een cultuurverschil is. Ontbijten in dit hotel was ook niet mogelijk, door al het geschreeuw en lawaai.   Het hotel zelf zal prima zijn, maar in het hoogseizoen zou ik afraden om hier naar toe te gaan. Kamers zijn

h_title_comment: Nice hotel, shame about the customer serviceâ€¦
h_comment: Customer Service in the hotel is non existent..  The rooms are comfy and well equipped but the air conditioning works as being very hot or very cold  Wi-Fi is also an issue in the rooms  This is a Japanese Hotel and there is a strong language barrier as there are no bilingual staff that work at the hotel.

Me any my family stay for a day in hotel.. At arrival staff assist luggage, we have good and big clean room.. Inside room very good facilities like complimentary minibar, full amenities, iron and iron board, etc.. Soft and comfortable bed.. We order room service food, that need to be improve.. we order pizza, some ingredients missing..  We leave tray outside of room.. until next day no one pick up.. HK need to be more attentive.. Early morning good breakfast buffet.. We enjoyed japanese lunch in hotel as well.. food quality need to improve and need bit of more option for both food and drink menu..  Overall we will back and recommend to my friends..

Our friend paid for two nights of Nikko Hotel Hai Phong on 2022.10.29.  On the second day, 2022.10.30, after going out and returning to the hotel, we were locked out.  Upon talking to the front desk staff An Phi, she said we only paid for one night and we had to pay for the second night before we were allowed to go back to our rooms.  We asked her to double check but she declined.   We had no choice but paid the second night. Later on, I contacted my friend.  He said he would bring the receipts for two nights that he paid for. Indeed, he did so.  The same hotel staff then reluctantly refunded us with an unhappy face.  I requested a simple apology from her.  She absolutely refused.  What kind of hotel is this?

Do not visit! I checked in last night.  Iâ€™m on the 12th floor and couldnâ€™t get to sleep as there was very loud music blasting out. I was advised that there was a private party!  To make the matter even worse I was woken up at 6.30am this morning with exactly the same music.  My colleagues and I will not be staying here again!  Expensive hotel with low attention to the needs of the customer. Not acceptable to not to be given the opportunity to sleep.  Rob

h_name: Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa
h_comment: Japaneses have a great symbol in Danang. But they don't care about their quality services. It was so terrible when I checked in the luxury room about 450$/per night but It wasn't cleaned. I lost 300$ to change another flight. Never ever comback to MIKAZUKI Danang. Japanese hotel, Japanese

Disappointed in our time here given the price

The breakfast buffet was also very good with plenty of options. The rooftop pool is fantastic and offers a stunning panorama over the city. However, there was a nagging issue during the whole stay, elevators. We had to spend sometimes close to 10 minutes waiting for an elevator. Beautiful art in hotel, with disappointing service. The hotel is run down. 1 out of the 4 elevators are not working. You wait forever to get an elevator. I've stayed at incredible hotels around the world and across Vietnam. This was the biggest disappointment. Do not get the corner room, as I literally had to pee sideways to fit. I ordered a mushroom pizza and they used canned mushrooms. Not sure why, when everywhere else in Vietnam had gorgeous variety of fresh mushrooms. Pool area, gorgeous pool but had to wait 45 minutes to get service and they still got it wrong. h_title_comment: Great views - Not worth the money!!
h_comment: The rooftop pool is lovely and the views are wonderful.   Food is well below what you would expect from a 5 star and certainly not worth the money.  If you donâ€™t mind waiting an hour for an average plate of good then this is for you.   I would suggest staying at another local hotel and getting a pool day pass to see the views.  Rooms are tiny and dated.  Air conditioning is ok.  Overall donâ€™t waste your money here, better spent elsewhere.

The rooms were a bit out of date and the staff at the reception  we less than friendly during check-in. The staff at tours desk was very nice as well as the room service folks. The grounds in front were well kept but near river could use a bit sprucing up.

I have stayed here with my business partners during a business meeting in Binh Duong province and was quite satisfy with this hotel's service. They responsed quickly to our request and arranged everything almost perfect. Rooms were enough space with all necessary items, clean and tidy and really value-to-money. It has many spaces with trees and also a place where we organized many team building activities including food court and games. Their staff was really helpful and fast responsive upon our request. But the location is not really perfect and sometimes hardly to get a taxi if you do not have your own vehicle. That's why I recommend this hotel for group travellers or the one had their own vehicle.

h_comment: We stayed from 29 Dec 2022 to 1 Jan 2023. I stayed here for 4 weeks and the room was comfortable, staff were good and the location was quiet. It's fairly cheap and better for long stay. Taxis are available. The staff speak some English. There's a pool, restaurant and tennis court.

So I stayed at this hotel for 2.5 months so I feel I have a lot to say. Since I stayed a long time they gave me a very good discount on the room. Once they charged me less one month just to be nice. Staff extremely helpful. Rooms were nice in a nice area. Lets talk about the many cons. 1. The cleaning ladies are absolutely worthless at their jobs. After every cleaning day I stood baffled at how terrible of a job they have done. Even laundry was often returned to me so wrinkled I couldn't even iron it and had to return items to laundry bin(probably left in washing machine overnight). After one cleaning day my tie clip and little pocket pen(wasn't cheap AND it was a gift) went missing after the once a week cleaning. I have an undressing ritual where everything goes in the same  place, I didn't misplace it. I went and got another tie clip but could not find a fancy new pen. Next cleaning day that tie clip also went missing. I also had some personal towels I didnt use since the hotel supplied towels. Those went missing too. No chance they mixed them up with the hotel towels, the hotel towels have the hotel name on them... mine didnt. My girlfriend also claimed some of her more fashionable blouses went missing. Sometimes we got clothes that wasn't ours. Laundry was free... but I would have preferred to pay if it meant they would do half a decent job. So the cleaning ladies were banned from my room. Front desk guys are awesome, super friendly and nice, however if you need something you have to ask numerous times because they forget or are too lazy. Location is only good if you have personal transport, its REALLY on the city outer limits so you need a motorbike. Being on built on the edge of the wilderness there is an abundance of insects, I moved up one floor from ground level and it solved the problem for the most part. After 5 days on ground level I eradicated 100 centipedes, 2 cockroaches and a few flyers. No problems after going to second floor.. except for ants which I dealt with. They have a mini fridge but it was rarely stocked appropriately so on the rare occasions I needed something, they didn't have it or it wasn't cold. Last thing, AC took a long time to cool down the room, even when it had been running all day I slept with blankets at ankles. It was a close call between 2 and 3 stars. For the price I paid for the room I got, Id say it was a good deal. Just don't let cleaning ladies in unattended and don't be afraid to tell them they forgot to change towels... again or you didn't even sweep... again.... or they left the trash... again or any other variety of things they are bound to forget. Wow was this a rant or a review?

The Hotel service cant complain, because there is no service. The rooms are smal and extrem old inventar. The shower head in the cabin is not adjustable, when u open the water u have to get wet right away. There are ants in the room. The bed sheets are dirty. The balcony door cant get closed, because it was opend by force some when in the past. The breakfast is Toast, egg, soup, 2 kinds of marmelade, 3 Juice, milk, fruids. Not so bad, but no knife at all. Internet WLAN have but very slow. Not to recomend at all

A very affordable, nice and clean hotel in a very quiet street. The bottled water in the fridge is not complimentary. We did not know and drank from there for 4 days and when we checked out, we realized that it was chargeable. The staffs couldn't speak english. Just yes, no and ok. But they were very friendly. Always smiling. It is near a cafe. (Thuc cafe) a nice place to chill out with a glass of very good coffee.

Stayed here for 3 months and was made to feel like family within a few days. All the staff know you by name and which room you are in.  Rooms are clean and comfortable although new travelers to Asia might find the beds hard. The bathroom is small but adequate. Breakfast is provided daily. Very basic - cereal, toast, fruit and they offer eggs or pho. Bottled water in the room is NOT complimentary which I did not learn about until I was presented with a bill at the end of my first month. I quickly asked them to remove all items from my room for which I could be charged and they were happy to do that. I would say this is a 2-3 star hotel but perfectly comfortable

h_title_comment: Beware very dirty no care of guests
h_comment: Met with the owner on Jan 25th to arrange a 7 night stay. Upon arrival on the next day the room was full of bugs , bathroom and bed. Sheets stained, no personal safe in the room. Wish they had a negative star rating.  We paid upfront for 7 days. When asking for a refund the owner would only return 6 days of room rent. We had only left our bags on the room.  There is no staff no breakfast offered even though says online. Hotel is dusty dirty and very unkept.   Many other great reasonably priced hotels/ resorts near by.   Zoom in pic to see black spots bugs everywhere

Very noisy because right aside the highway. Very inconvenient transportation spot. The bus stop is far away from hotel and you have to add to your expenses bills for taxi. Very unfriendly stuff.   Very rude old cleaning woman. Receptionist and cleaning stuff were unfriendly and put me in humiliation situation. They checked my booking and refused to check in because they were not satisfied with the price that I payed per night even though it was their official price on all booking resources (booking.com, trip.com, agoda etc.) they wanted more money per night even though they don't have many customers these days and I could be permanent guest, all I needed was to make sure that hotel meet my expectations. They ignored all my tries to solve the situation and ignored my requests and  even didn't try to co-operate. The hotel's stuff didn't act as people and people who are not interested in customers at all! Instead they somewhy danced and lied right on the bed behind the registration desk like they just live there and I just inconvenient interruption of their careless life. And when after 2 hours 'negotiations' they canceled my booking because they were not satisfied with the price I payed online. I left the hotel and I walked for 3 km. to the nearest bus stop to find some better option to stay.

h_title_comment: Good service & suitable for first time visit
h_comment: If you first time to ho chi Minh and looking for some great local food & good attraction you definitely can ask the hotel secretary (Long) here, he is kind & friendly, he can recommended a lot of good local foods & attraction, good communication. The only one things is not satisfied it was lift, you have take some time to wait.

Location is convenient and itâ€™s only 15mins away from airport. Staff is nice and friendly. The room is unexpected nice and comfortable. But the lift is terribly slow and I think itâ€™s not a good idea that hotel staff should use the lift.

We stayed here for two nights on a business trip. Obviously not a four-star. The hotel is big but lots of renovation needed. A bit noisy at night sometimes because there're a karaoke bar on the top floor and a train track nearby. Room looks a bit dark and wooden furniture are rather dated.   On a positive note, in the summer the nice swimming pool may make up for its downside. There's a restaurant open till late so it's very convenient and buffet breakfast was good. Wifi connection was fast and free. Staff are friendly.

(2) Non existing service,  not even a call to the bus station was made.  (3) English not exists  (4) Overcharge (20k D/small buttle) for a too large number of usually complementary drinking water. and really MEAN, they like kept us prisoner for half an hour because of the water (i did think the flooding outside . but now, the 20.000 they charched to little before ...)

h_title_comment: Okay place for a stop ocer
h_comment: Friendly staff although no English when we were staying there, nice food around the hotel, very quiet and no westerners so not much English was spoken. Not bad room for the price. Easy to find, although security out the front tried to rip us off with our bike heading to the resort and said we had to pay to enter the hotel.

Travelled all day from HCMC down to Bac Lieu, only wanted a hotel for the night. Checked into this one. Showing signs of wear and tear. Typical of most provincial hotels in Vietnam, basically lack of maintenance. However the prices were reasonable (breakfast included- more later on that). The room was clean with very efficient AC plus fans, bathroom clean, good shower, plenty of hot water, bed nice and comfortable. Had a good nights sleep, undisturbed, which is what it is all about. Breakfast, Pho (but with pork - not good) alternative was eggs, bread roll, with a slice or two of tomato, not much better, coffee not even up to bad. But, refreshed by a good rest, we were happy enough. This hotel would be very nice if they would just clean up the place and attend to basic minor  room furniture damage, the old Vietnamese problem of lack of maintenance is the only problem, do something with the breakfasts and it would be great. But, as mentioned the room we had was fine, comfortable and no complaints, chips and dents in furniture excepted.

h_title_comment: If you looking for a quite night - this is the place
h_comment: I booked a small single room. And it was not so small after all. It comes with a table, chairs, a fridge, TV, AC, and a fan. Shower and toilet of course in a separate room. The bed is big and comfy. The best thing about the place is that it is really quiet at night. It is far enough from the street so you do not hear traffic. I had a great night's rest.

h_name: Capital O 585 Saigon Book Da Lat Hotel
h_title_comment: Near Xuan Huong lake, nice room
h_comment: I've arrived at mid night, hard to call them to open the door but the admin on FB was so good to reply me immediately. The hotel was near Xuan Huong lake & Thanh Buoi bus station, we had Thanh Buoi staffs pick up us there. The room was ok, quite large to use, nice window and view, even we've just got a garden view room. The bathroom was not because it always got wet after taking bath due to bad drainage. The staffs can speak English & Chinese. At night, customers from the other room talked quite loudly and it's not good enough to sleep well. First day arrival also have a little problem at 05am with the electricity so it's really hot but the electronic was fixed in the early morning luckily. The cleaning staffs also helped to reorganize the bedroom on the 1st afternoon but not  for the all 4 days we've stayed.

h_title_comment: Unprofessional, rigid, hostile receptionists and guards, unresponsive managements.
h_comment: This was probably the most unprofessional staffs and services I have experienced.  Before coming to Hanoi, I received an email saying that all guests who live in the government-deemed Covid â€œred zoneâ€ would have to take a rapid test to stay at the hotel. Since I am from Saigon - a â€œgreen zoneâ€, I figured that this was not an issue at all. However, when I came to hotel where they charged me for the full stay, they claimed that my accent is Northern and since my identification is from Hanoi, I have to take a rapid test. Even though I tried to explain to them that it was my grandparents house and before I can show them other evidences such as my passport and boarding pass, they proceeded to cancel my reservation but did not choose to notify the company that I used to book my stay.

h_title_comment: The second time of my visit to Vinh, central Vietnam.
h_comment: The second time of my visit to this beautiful beach city Vinh in 2017. I stayed in this hotel because it was reasonable price. The good points of this hotel are: near the sea, good breakfast service, wifi okay. The bad points are: the staff don't speak English very well, very few English channels and too many Vietnamese channels TV set.

Small room, high price, no complimentary water, super small toilet and worst of all, they charge PARKING FEE. This is the first time I've been to a 3-star hotel that charges parking fee. So disappointed.

A very poor 3 stars hotel located 1 minutes from the beach.   The building is old and you can smell the mold almost every where in the hotel.  The toilet and the shower are very tiny and not comfortable.  I'm sure you can find better place to put your had overnight.

h_title_comment: worst service/hotel ever! not a 3 star...
h_comment: really annoyed with this hotel, after a long journey on a bike to get here i thought i would treat myself to luxury to a 3 star hotel, i had prebooked a ''deluxe double room with garden view', i got here they tried to put us in a cold smelly room outside hotel that was still a building site!! there was a lot of vietnamese here at some sort of party, we were given a little bit better room in the hotel itself, we were told there was no restaurant i could clearly see one, we were told there was only breakfast, a local woman came over spoke to them and they escorted us to dinner table and gave us a menu?? relieved we could get food at this stage thanks to the local woman, the hotel staff then became some what nice to us, we had our meal joined the party and had a good night, the  next day we had to stay to get our bike fixed so wasnt bothered changing rooms.to much hassle, they cant speak any english its a nightmare, we were so hungry for dinner looking forward to our meal like we had last night, asked about dinner was told no! closed! rude [--]! a friend of ours who is also staying in the hotel was told dinner at 6pm, we said great we will wait untill then. 6pm came no still hungry and still no dinner! it doesn't feel like a hotel i have stayed in better huts on the beach, i didnt want a hut i wanted luxury thats why i chose a 3 star but in this case it was not to be.    as for the rooms its a [--]! AVOID AVOID AVOID.

There are not many budget hotels in Vinh since the city really isn't a place tourists would stop by. The staff doesn't speak much English. The restaurant and cafe do not seem to be open during the low season, and the staff were a bit noisy during the morning. With that said, the hot water was great after a long, wet motorbike ride, and the parking attendant was a really nice, sweet old man who interacted with us a bit.

Staff here are nice, friendly and helpful. Price is also reasonable. If you look for a luxurious place, it might not be the one but it is definitely worth staying here. It is accessible to main shopping streets of the city as well as the train station.

I am staying here with my family. The hotel has great location, nice staff but the room is normal. I highly recommend others to eat outside cause the meals in the hotel is quite standard with higher price.

h_title_comment: Good basics, some english, Vietnamese friendeliness
h_comment: Clean hotel, nice staff, catering for Vietnamese families and groups. Do not expect things to be quiet early morning or late evening as families and groups of company staffs are roaming though the corridors laughing and chatting day and night. Basic but OK bathroom, Vietnamese breakfast and meals but you can get an omelet sandwich and local coffee in the morning. Strangely, they do not put sheets between the one covering the mattress and the blanket 2 times out of 4.....

h_title_comment: You Won't Get a Good Nights Rest Here
h_comment: The mattress was hard as a rock, no give.The demolition in the hotel started at 7:15, with roto hammers and sledge hammers. The power went out, so no hot water, no bath. When I complained to the staff, several of them started laughing, big joke. The elevator was out, maybe because of the power. I gave up, and moved down the street to another hotel. This hotel is in the furniture district , with no restaurants nearby to walk to in the dark, if you get in late.

I opted for the suite both days to the tune of $30/night.. Room was basic but big, TV in both rooms. Bathroom was worn and the bed was like sleeping on a piece of plywood. There are lots of events so it gets extremely noisy early on the day; it seems like nobody has regard for the time of day. Both mornings I as woken up at 5am by EXTREMELY loud talking and noise in the halls.  I gave the front desk my passport as is customary in some hotels; they returned it and it looked as it it was left out in the rain. They said it was due to "humidity" haha, no. Upon coming back from working in the field and checking in I gave them my drivers license and refused to give them my passport. Also had a woman on two separate occasions barge into my room without knocking so I kept it locked and  the chain on the door. Free wifi and breakfast if that's your thing.  Overall, pretty worn rooms and bad sleep quality. If you have to be in Vinh City, there are better hotels for the price.

This hostel is too bad such as hard matress, dirty room & suburban location. The staff couldn't speak English (just a little), even though asking the local map and train station, they couldn't understand what I needed. Do not recommend !

h_title_comment: It is the only one that you can choose if you need to stop in vinh
h_comment: We stopped in Vinh because we arrived from Laos and we need to stop one nigh waiting for the next bus. It is a Gouvernative hotels, but it is clean, the rooms are big and at 13 $ you have the breakfast too. The staff is very friendly but speak English just  a little. It is situated in a park. The others Hotels with the same price are terrible!

Positives: huge TV with great cable, close to cinema/supermarket, well stocked mini bar.  Negatives: We arrived late from the train station, around 10:30pm, and were checked in by staff who spoke zero english. About an hour later, reception phoned, claiming we hadnt paid and asking us to come downstairs. We managed to find our agoda.com booking and payment confirmation in their emails, which solved the issue, however staff were not at all apologetic about having phoned us at almost midnight.  The shower handle was broken, meaning water only flowed when you held up the handle - not that there was any hot water anyway. The bathroom was dirty, but that didn't compare to the strong stench of cigarettes that dominated the room. The one blanket provided was damp and smelly,  accompanying a bed that was rock hard even by Vietnamese standards. The room did not have a remote for the air con - we did manage to sort this with staff despite the language difficulty.  The strangest part of the trip was on our second day, when we asked the receptionist to place a bag containing our passports and about $100USD in the safe. We received a phone call at about 8pm in Vietnamese and some exclamations of "money, money, money" in English... so headed down to reception - who claimed not to have phoned. At 10:30pm we received another phone call along the same lines, and told them we would deal with the issue in the morning. At 11pm a housekeeper knocked on our door, barged into the room and herded us down to reception, where the receptionist angrily handed us back our passports and cash, as though we had asked her to store cocaine at the reception desk. I am still unsure exactly what the issue was, but the multitude of late night phone calls, anger about our inability to speak Vietnamese, and general rudeness of the staff made for a fairly unpleasant trip.  Would not recommend.

I d like to stay there for 2 Nights, the Room is worth the money, not bad for the price, ...its a 2 Star Hotel so i didnÂ´t expect much. On first Sight OK, didnÂ´t smell, nice.   A lot of Chinese and Vietnamese People, made it much more lifely.  But in the Morning i was woken up by loud construktion work, (ok not their fault)  when i come down to breakfast, i realice they donÂ´t like me here. They put me beside the normal dining room to the next door. Ok i thougth eat your breakfast and go. But even this wasnÂ´t to easy as i figured out. I ordered Coffe-Phin-Sua, as always, and asked for my opions. They brought me a smal card, but as i ordered everywere they said NO. Bread with Omlett then.... they brought me a bum and omlett, without anything, ...after i stopped on of them the  served chopsticks and a fork. I told them at least i need salt&pepper, they brought me empty ones, with a smirk in their face. I went to the reception, but she also dont WANT to understand as i figured out.   Ok, i tought your in Vietnam eat some breakfast the lokals do. But the donÂ´t want to serve me anymore, cause all the process took over 40 Minutes, ...so with a smile she points on the watch: "Kitchen finished" ...The Coffe comes without milk, despite i ordered correct AS EVERY-WERE/DAY ...i was served a bowl with warm water, a instantnoodlebrick inside and a few herbs, and some barely warm Beef meat.... couldnÂ´t eat that !! Watching out of the Window i saw the Turtel trieing to escape. So i come back to my room find the staff cleaning, ..."fresh" sheets, !? ... I pointing on a stain of dried blood on a sheet, but she didnÂ´t care just smirked.   At least they gave me a little discount for no breakfast after argue more... 30 k ...i was still starving and have wasted my morning.  FAZIT: The Than Vinh Hotel could be a very nice one, stylish Rooms are clean(if they want) but their focus is on vietnames or chinese (i m not sure) business people. Despite this fakt, they should at least try to fullfil some basic demands of western people, or just simply say NO to them front up to prefent trouble for both sides in the future. Westerners not welcome, is their attitude.  So i m sorry to say STAY AWAY as a recomandation of this Hotel.
