Attention !!!   Cet hÃ´tel nâ€™a rien dâ€™un 5 Ã©toiles.   Le service nâ€™est pas Ã  la hauteur : le wifi marche trÃ¨s mal, jâ€™ai eu une intoxication en mangeant dans un des restaurent de lâ€™hÃ´tel, le bar est fermÃ© Ã  22h45, le staff fait le minimum viable pour rÃ©pondre Ã  vos attentes etc.   Bref, la liste est longue pour Ã©noncer lâ€™ensemble des points nÃ©gatifs qui font que cet hÃ´tel nâ€™a rien dâ€™un hÃ´tel 5 Ã©toiles occidental.   English:  This hotel is not a 5 star hotel.   Hello everyone, I do not like to put this type of comment but for this hotel I had to do it.   This hotel has nothing of a 5 stars.  The service is not up to the mark: the wifi works very poorly, I got intoxicated while eating in one of the restaurants of the hotel, the bar is closed at 10:45 pm, the staff does the minimum

We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. In comparison to other hotels we saw in HCMC it was very modern. The price was very reasonable for 5 star. The rooms were spacious and well decorated. The roofrop pool was a highlight and had an amazing view of the city. There was a huge selection of food for breakfast. Staff were friendly.  There were however some negatives. The sound insulation in the rooms is poor and you can hear even the TV in the next room. There is only a handful of beds at the pool and it's impossible to get one. A la carte food is overpriced and not a great standard. It feels like it is missing something that a 5 star should have. We felt it was closer to a 4 star hotel. It was not that clean and the finishes were not up to 5 star standard.

Most of the staff (especially at the reception) is not very professional and efficient.  The room was very small for an hotel that pretend to be a 5 stars and it lacks in cleaning and facilities (any chairs for the luggages available for example). Breakfast was mediocre. Location is ok. Nice the infinity pool on the rooftop. For sure La Vela Saigon is not a 5 stars hotel.

h_title_comment: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at
h_comment: This would have to be the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I was told breakfast closed at 10am and upon arriving at 9:30am all the food had been taken away as it actually closes at 9am- ridiculously early. The bathroom curtain was decorated with native insects whilst the complimentary water bottles are small enough to quench the thirst of a lizard and nothing more. The meal from room service was quite literally the worst meal Iâ€™ve ever eaten. You could find a meal that tastes just as good from the garbage bin. Cold, microwaved pizza and a chicken curry that had been cooking for approximately 3 months. The only two good things about this hotel are the pool and the gym. The pool is incredible and the gym manager is very lovely and helpful. Otherwise, donâ€™t waste your

High-class restaurants and amazing infinity pool. Good room-service and technical supporters. Deluxe room is quite normal with average interiors. The corridor is quite dark and lacking of elevators. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE with many issues in check-in process, POOR PROBLEM SOLVING when room is not available and having electrical issues, SUPER BAD ATTITUDE from receptionists. I WILL NEVER COME BACK!

The first time ever that I have had to experience such a terrible service! I am so mad that I have to write this review while sitting at the lobby waiting to check out.  I hope no one will have to suffer this terrible service like me!

The pool is beautiful but everything else is a letdown. Poor customer service during breakfast service and around the poolbar. Inattentive staff and wrong food/drink orders. I wasn't impressed with the quality of our room and it felt way below the standards of other 5* hotel rooms in the city. A lot of the food at breakfast was stuck under heatlamps for hours so it was lukewarm and very uneappealing. A very lacklustre experience. This is not a 5* hotel.

- Reception at check-in should make their guests aware that parking is free. Concierge should be taking bags up to the rooms for guests. - Our room smelled musty. There were cigarette burns on the carpet near the window and a big stain. The windows weren't soundproofed enough so you could hear every motorbike horn outside. No tables or chairs on the balcony to enjoy it. Extremely difficult to maneuver out of the door to get to the balcony which seemed like a massive design-flaw. The TV's in the rooms seemed cheap (the picture/sound quality wasn't great) and not up to standard for a 5 star hotel. I would also have expected a vanity table for women to apply their makeup in the room. Minibar snacks and drinks were extremely basic. Toiletries (shampoo, body wash and lotion) in the

I've stayed at this hotel 3 times now.  Each time there was something not quite right. The keycard broke off in the door slot.  They gave me the wrong room....with no apology.  The toilet didn't work.  The safe stuffed up locking my valuables...needed to be reset. They don't give conditioner bottles...i asked but they just gave me more shampoo.  English amongst staff is poor...i don't have that issue in other hotels in HCMC. I know its sounds fickle...but it's these little things that should be more professional.  I think everyone goes for the pool which is amazing and is why i go there.......but not again....better hotels in HCMC which look after customers...at a much better price. Without the pool...this hotel would suffer....they know that.  You just feel like you're another

h_title_comment: Nice hotel  from outside but poor  management and very poor rooms
h_comment: First of all i was very happy to stay in this hotel !! Mr Dat the head of reception was so nice during my booking that i was exited to have a nice weekend!! But arriving at the floor the corridor was dark and feel like poor local hotel . In the room all buttons ON/OFF is near the entrance door which mean if you need to used the bathroom go to your door first !!  No plug in to used the laptop , i have to unplug the television and be carefull because  high risk of shock yourself.  I wish to book for the dimsun buffet but was not welcome by the girl on the phone who wanted to charge full price for a 3 years old baby !! She argue on the phone that was the policy if the kids is higher than 1m !! Girl you are working in hospitality & services not in an administration !!  Very bad

I put 1 extra star for the infinitive pool and the rooftop bar. They are beautiful.   The room is quite small. The service is totally terrible. What they advertised on facebook is a scam, there's nothing like "all you can eat" or anything alike. They served me old dimsum (or they didn't really want to serve me at all!).   There was clear discrimination in the way they treat expats and Vietnamese. When I complained, I didn't receive even a sorry from anyone.   I will never ever come back.

The hotel located in a quite place not far from Thank you city center.  Small room and very clean and cheap   The lady in the reception speak English, which is very convenient.  I found two problems first is the mattress, Vietnamese style, very hard and the second is that the flor in the bathroom always wet ( at least in my room)

We picked our laundry up After 28 hrs, but we got it back wet. Charged us 500k for about 6-7 kg laundry. Couldnt give us a specification for it. Said we didnt agree with it and got 125k discount on it eventually.  At first we got a room with the toilet leaking. Bathroom smelled like sewage because of that. After mentioning it the security guy mopped the floor and that was it. By the way it was quite an unfriendly and grumpy man. HÃ© gave me the impression hÃ© didnt want to help us out and was Just looking at us grumpy and pointing to things.   Shortly After that we found out that the room wasnt the one on the picture and mentioned about it. That's when we got our room changed.   The refrigerator was leaking every time we went out of the room because the electricity would go out.   When we noticed they overcharged us for the laundry, we checked the roomrate. So they convert the amount in dollars by 23k. They said everywhere in Vietnam its multiplied by 23k. As far as i know it always has been multiplied bij 22k. And she told me to check the currency. It was 22.2. Because they were acting so doubtful, i asked what price they would charge the room in Vietnamese dong and not the dollarprice converted to VD. The manager handsigned not to give it to us or that they didnt have it.   This is a fairly New and neat hotel. But we dont believe these are honest People.   During our stay a lot of drunken Vietnamese men were making noise in the hallway. Even After midnight. Probably its a hotel for People getting laid.

Upon arrival a nice lady showed us to our room which was reasonable. I went out for a look at their 'swimming pool' but it was green and nasty. The restaraunt was shut the whole time we were there. There was no internet either!  Receptionist agreed to a reasonable 40% discount but the following day the manager refused to honour this and refused to return the passports and also refused to call the police to settle things effectively extorting the money from us! I am complaining to head office. Seriously do not stay here. In 3 years of world travel and countless Asian hotels I haven't experienced anything this shocking. Avoid at all costs!

Cua Lo is beautiful but this is a Vietnamese Tourist destination, our group were the only Caucasians it the town. The staff at the hotel speak no English and we found it hard to communicate even with google translate. Do not get your laundry done here either, it cost us 400,000 dong for about 2kg. CRAZY!!!! They charged $40 US per night, twice what we were paying every where else.....not worth it.  Hardest bed in Vietnam (we travelled in budget hotels over 6 nights from Hanoi to Hoi An). The towels are tiny and scarce, not very clean and our room smelt like smoke. The only benefit, it is across from the beach and we had a nice balcony. Not interested in ever coming back to this hotel.

h_title_comment: Very nice and helpful staff, nice rooms
h_comment: We wanted to stay just 1 night, but because I got sick on the first day we stayed another 2 nights. The hotel staff was excellent. One of the best staff we have met in Vietnam. They helped me to get medicaments (translated in Vietnamese), they helped to order food in the Restaurant (because the staff in the restaurant didn't speek English) and one of the staff member even gave me her telefone-number that I can call her in case of a problem.... The rooms were also very nice and you get a lot for your money. The only "bad" thing that I could say is that the mattresses are a little bit hard.

Firstly all the restaurants see a tourist coming and then they charge you a fortune for food! Be prepared to be ripped off! And only found 1 place in the town that serves cold drinks! Hotel is not like the pics. It's old, stained sheets, wifi doesn't work. Air con does work which is good, beds are decent and TV works. Manager was good enough to give me a bit of money back for things not being up to scratch which was nice but the damage was already done.

A nice hotel very close to the beach, not particularly luxurious but it is clean and comfortable. A good budget range hotel with friendly, helpful staff.  Just cross the road and you are literally on the beach, lots of good seafood places to eat along the beach. Also try the steamed filled rolls from one of the mobile sellers, they are a speciality in this area and only cost 10,000 vnd, very tasty!

On our motorcycle journey from Hanoi to Saigon, we stopped in Vinh for one night. The Bank Star Cua Lo Hotel was one of a number of resorts built for the high-season in summer. We rode through Vietnam at the tale-end of winter, so the costal community was a relative ghost-town. The room was comfortable and we paid a great price, because it was low-season. The room had a fridge, great hot water, a television, a balcony and some rather hard beds - which we slept on, as we were exhausted from the ride.  The man at reception was helpful, ensuring that our bike was parked securely for the night. He also suggested some good food close-buy. We walked up the street to a food-vendor who made us a fantastic duck soup with all the trimmings. They also do barbecued duck. One of the best  meals I have had in Vietnam...Truly traditional. From the front of the hotel, you turn right and walk up the main road for about 200m and it is on the left-hand side of the road. Due to the distance that we rode that day, we should have stayed in the city centre. However, this was well-priced accommodation that offered an individual experience.

We were very impressed by the courage of Mr. Tran Dinh Thang (sales manager) who helped us to claim back part of an overpriced lunch invoice. He took us on his own motorbike to the restaurant in question and discussed with them although he was afraid of their reaction. Really an outstanding service!

h_name: KhÃ¡ch Sáº¡n Tuáº¥n Anh Cá»­a LÃ²
h_title_comment: excellent low price option, a minute from the beach!
h_comment: An excellent and very cheap option only a minute or two walk to the beach. Onsite restaurant serving good and cheap food.  Room: Was basic but clean, good size, private bathroom, balcony, wrrobe and desk with beside tables and power outlets. Bed and pillows were comfortable.  Bathroom: Basic but clean, hot water reliable and good water pressure  Wifi Average but acceptable and good enough for basic emails, web searching  Location Amazing and perfect, a minute walk to the beach, a heap of restaurants and food option downstairs and along the street. A minute away from a small but fun amusement park overlooking the beach and with some rides and games for fun.  Staff Outstanding for vietnam! Especially Tuan, a young guy who speaks good english and is extremely helpful and all do  anything to assist and make your stay comfortable.   Other stuff: Basically if your looking for a budget option with everything you need, although basic is a perfect "travellers" choice. if you are looking for a bit of luxury or only on  holiday and not backpacking or on extended travels- best to try one of the higher star rated and full service hotels nearby. however we love our time here with Tuan.

h_title_comment: You will be amazed at how horrid this place is ğŸ˜‚
h_comment: Please trust a random stranger here when I say avoid this place if you can. It is extremely expensive in comparison to nice places up the road and youâ€™ll regret it.   The owner speaks little English and tries to make as much money from you as possible. We had to wait for him to arrive to check in and waited an hour to check out. When he opened the door to our room it had hundreds of bugs, dead and alive, in the bed and all over the floor (the bed is also a stale hard piece of bread on the ground). We stayed up until midnight removing bugs from in the bed, under the bed and amongst everything in the room. One bug that flew in while we opened the door to sweep other dead bugs out and it was the size of a small bird. R.I.P. We honestly couldnâ€™t believe it.   Then the toilets are  just as dirty and smelly as the rest of the place. So Iâ€™ll just leave that there and say we didnâ€™t even shower and waited until the next place.   Another guy that stayed there snuck out of his room and into the dorm as his didnâ€™t have a mosquito net in an open air room.   Cute dogs though. And if you like toads, there is heaps outside the door and on the footpaths. Did I mention bugs?

Facilities: The best thing about this resort is its massive salt water pool. It is really large with different areas for children and adult. There are also resting/sitting areas inside the pool.  Other than the pool, there is nothing else to commend about the facilities. The attention to details in construction and design is just not there. Our family rented a sea-view villa and an apartment with 2 bedrooms each. The sea-view villa is so inefficiently designed, the rooms are tiny, the bathroom is extremely tiny, we felt we were in some really cheap hotel. The apartment is better. The sea-view villa costed double that of the apartment, my advice is to never bother with sea-view villa if you ever stay here. The layout of the room and furniture makes it very inconvenient.  Construction quality is poor, making the resort feel like at least 4-5 yrs old if not more. The beach is dirty with lots of rocks and stones. Overall, facilities are very much below standard with the exception of the pool.  Services:  Again, very sub-par standard. Beach towels always ran out. Pastries at breakfast were so low quality my kid took one bite and refused to have a second bite. Our family arrived early, when we asked for early check-in, without even checking, the receptionist gave a no answer straight away. I had to ask to speak her manager before she bothered to check and sure enough there were rooms ready for us.  Being a short distance from Hanoi, we were hoping this could provide a destination for short get away trip. Our family can safely say we will not be back anytime soon.

This hotel seems to have different understanding of privacy. The cleaners holds a spare key of every room and will open anytime they wish to clean. I mean ANYTIME. They will force open the room (because they have the key) and will not bother to knock. Luckily, I was able to lock the secondary lock. This is an old hotel. Maintenance is poor. So I am not really surprised if their customer service is this bad. But invasion of privacy.... that's too much. I put my things all over the room. Knowing this is Vietnam, they are not willing to pay for any lost items. Even if it is their mistake. So if you are an unlucky traveller and stayed in this hotel, just be careful.

The best four things about this place were: 1) an openable window (because the room smelt so so so very bad) 2) carpet that did not have burnt patches revealing the concrete floor underneath  3) 2 beds in our room, we could pile up the blankets from one bed to another and cushion our backs from the wooden planks directly beneath 4) hot water  We only stayed for one night passing through town and spent as much time as possible outside the hotel. If you have another option, take it!

Especially if you go through agoda do not come to this hotel. It appeared to be connected to a brothel offering karaoke and massages with scantily clad girls hanging around. The room was pretty grim, the bathroom orange with filth and a few large cockroaches made an appearance. It was extremely loud through the thin front door that didn't shut properly. The staff were quite unhelpful and wifi was limited. But for a fiver a night what else can you expect?

We came here a few times and used to come back, but since some newer hotel are available we do not come back anymore. Food is okay. You only put one into this hotel once you do not like them since it can be very noisy during the night., but since there is a by pass the road is now a little bit more quite.

h_title_comment: Will be fine if you don't expect more than it can offer
h_comment: Ok, so I put this one on tripadvisor and here is what I thought:  Pros:  - Nice beach, new location that makes you feel wild and undiscovered - Well priced - Nice and clean rooms  Cons:  - The waves are too strong, and the beach is filled by local people - Isolated but not private enough. Better travel by car because the area is isolated - Services are lacking and not professional. The hotel staff opened my room at midnight (12:00) and said kind of: Oops, I thought there was nobody, sorry.  Overall, the "resort" is ok if you don't expect a resort quality level. Tell yourself you are going to a nice beach and stay in a guest house, and you will be fine.

Stayed here for just couple of hours. The hotel is 20-30 minutes walks from the railway station. We arrived around midnight, check-in was smooth. The room is spacious but the bathroom is small. We left early morning the next day about 6:00am, there was no one in the reception just the security who doesn't speak good english. We couldn't leave because they had my passport. The security was keep on calling his colleague, since it was taking so long I ended up taking my passport from the desk. It was okay, however I think it's better if you inform the reception upon check-in that you are leaving early so at least someone will be there.

We stopped here for one night on our way south from Hanoi. We booked it based on the location and the cheap price. Unfortunately the photo of a room we saw previously was misleading, the hotel was at best grubby, at worst dirty. We weren't expecting anything amazing for the equivalent of Â£10 a night, however I would expect cleanliness. The walls were dirty and damp in places, the shower curtain was dirty & mouldy and the bathroom was smelly. The staff were helpful enough but not particularly ffriendly, no smile or hello when we came down for a cold, meagre breakfast buffet. Wouldn't really recommend for anything other than location as a stopover. Nothing for tourists in Thanh Hoa itself

My boyfriend and I were just stopping over in Thanh Hoa for one night on our way to Vinh, so we decided to stay at this hotel based on its central location and positive reviews. We booked a standard double room in advance and when we arrived at the hotel the receptionist confirmed that it was a double room we wanted. But when we got to our room, it was a twin room. The room itself was okay, it didn't have a window but was spacious and at first glance seemed clean. However, as we started to unpack I discovered that part of the floor, wall and table were teeming with ants. This, combined with the bed situation, prompted us to go back to reception and request to change to a double room. The receptionists informed us that a double room would cost an additional 70, 000 VND, which we  agreed to pay. The double room was much larger and brighter as it had a window (without a view). It was also ant-free. The bed was large and comfortable, and the bathroom was also large. The bathroom initially appeared a bit grubby, but this turned out to just be some wear and tear (e.g. discoloured/scratched tiles) rather than dirt. After a comfortable sleep, the following morning we went down to the restauarant for breakfast. The food on offer was rather limited and unappealing, but what made it entirely unpalatable was that most of what was on offer was completely crawling with ants. The bread, the fruit, the fruit juice and coffee were infested. Vietnam's climate means that it is almost impossible to entirely eradicate insects, and having lived here for almost two years I am no stranger to ants, which are particularly persistent. But this was completely unacceptable for an hotel, and the staff didn't seem to be remotely fazed by the problem. I have stayed in countless hotels and guesthouses of varying standards during my time in Vietnam and never encountered this extent of infestation. With a little care and attention this hotel has the potential to be much better, but at present I would not recommend staying here, especially as there is no shortage of alternative accommodation available in Thanh Hoa that offers much better value for money.

We were just passing through Than Hoa after a long bus ride across the border from Laos and decided to stay the night before heading on. This place was perfect for a one night stopover. The rooms are big and clean with AC and good wifi. The showers are powerful. There's a substantial breakfast buffet (but get there early to avoid missing the fresh coffee). There's even a gym and a bar with pool table. The staff is smiley and friendly too. It's more of a business hotel than a travellers hotel, buys that's to be expected in this place....it doesn't get much tourism!

It's an old hotel but is good with the cheap price. Wide and comfortable bed, big furnitures, cable tv, clean room, great receptionist,....locate in the city center, quite ~15km far from Sam Son beach so you have to drive there.

Phu Dong is about 5 min walk from the railway station, which makes it very convenient. That's about the only advantage: rooms are grimy, dull, and not very clean. Bed is hard as a rock, breakfast is a joke, and the staff couldn't care less.

Nice hotel in a little town. We had deluxe rooms and really enjoyed the stay. + Great value for money. + Spacious, clean and tidy rooms with big windows. + Well-presented rooms and modern decor. + Good internet reception for free. + Approachable and polite staff.  - There were not many choices for brekky at hotel restaurant. - It's way too far from the beach.

A one night business stay in one of their "deluxe" rooms costing USD25/night Pros: * Large room * Reasonably clean * Enclosed shower to hopefully prevent water flooding the bathroom * Modern TV  * Free broadband * Fairly quiet location in town Cons: * My front room location was initially a bit noisy, but after 10pm most noise stopped and I slept well * Bathroom floor still filled up with water as shower enclosure had not been sealed to walls and base  *

a clean, comfortable and economically priced hotel.   Little english spoken but enough to be helpful.  It has an elevator and a nice bar on the top floor.  It is situated near the central mart where an amazing supply of local seafood is available at great prices.  Just have to find somewhere to cook it for you..... but never a problem.

h_title_comment: Hotel style accomodation, cheap and close to train station
h_comment: We stayed at the hotel for one night our way to Hanoi from Laos. The hotel is close to the train station - less than a 5 minute walk - and overlooks the main town square. One person on reception could speak english, which was a bonus as I dont think the town sees many tourists coming through - she was really helpful with explaining where to catch the train and buses.  The hotel has a cafe upstairs, which unfortunately only serves drinks - perfect if that is what you are after but not if you're really hungry. There is one restaurant around the corner of the hotel that serves an excellent dinner.  The rooms had a large double bed, hot water, TV, and small bar fridge.  The hotel is great for the close proximity to the train station and cheap rooms (US$13/night)

The hotel itself is nice, rooms are spacious and well decorated. The location is great and plenty of shops and eating places close by. There is a problem that the staff and owners don't seem to care about. on the top floor is a karaoke bar and after complaining and moving rooms i had to check out because of the noise.

Hai Tien is an upcoming resort with a nice beach and a layed back atmosphere. Most people here don't have to learn English to well as there are very few Westerners to engage with. If you want a hussle bussle trip this is not the resort for you. If you want to see and meet Vietnamese and converse in sign language from Vietnamese only menus, and learn what it's like for the local population to holiday then it's ideal. The Vietnamese are a polite respectful and engaging people. The Ivy Hotel is a budget hotel is functional and well situated.

h_comment: Clean, large room. Helpul staffs. Good location to go to Vietnam-China border, to Temple and centaal market of Mong Cai. Big car park Space, good view if you choose to stay from 8 Floor and up. breakfast is simple, need to be improved.

I was at this hotel briefly but long enough to be disappointed by the management.   During check-in I was with two associates who were not staying at the hotel. The manager insisted I had to book an additional room because they had been standing with me in the lobby. It seemed irrelevant to her that these people were my work associates and were staying at a different hotel. The manager's assumption must have been that were were going to sneak three people into a one bed hotel room and have a pillow fight?   I was not impressed with their service and assumptions, changed to the Li Lai Hotel.

h_title_comment: Large room, central location, but lousy service
h_comment: The hotel is quite centrally located, which is not far from restaurants and a short drive to the shopping centre. The room is large, with breakfast included, but we did not eat breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on the quality.  I booked the room via Booking.com, and provided an international mobile number (with my country code). Apparently the reception has tried to called me, but they called an international number with Vietnamese country code. So of course they couldn't reach me and then they cancelled my booking. I received a notification from Booking.com that my booking was cancelled and had I to contact the hotel. When asked why they cancelled my booking, I got a cold answer. It was because I didn't answer the phone so they thought I wouldn't showed up, and they are  scared that the room cannot be rent out. Very lazily done by the hotel staff for not being able to send a message on Booking.com when you are unable to contact the customer on mobile.

Ok hotel for money and in fairly good position to walk to shops, diners and harbour. A couple of things were disappointing including some indifferent staff ( there were some great ones as well ) a shower over bath with no screen so impossible not to flood bathroom and. â€˜Balconyâ€™ which isnâ€™t really a balcony. Rooftop bar closed. Breakfast menu was limited but what was on offer was ok. The area is very quiet due to post Covid ? So hopefully picks up soon. Wasnâ€™t really made to feel welcome by staff, local business owners or locals for that matter, probably wouldnâ€™t stay again as heaps of competition in area.

8.5 mil per night for 2 pers, our family have 2 children so we have to pay 1.7 mil for extra fee. Service: welcome fruit, mochi, breakfast, onsen bath (public + private), sauna.  Villa is too small, only ~50m2 with 1 king size bed, table + sit chair, no tatami mat,  small garden (30m2) with very basic landscape. It's more likely studio with garden than a real villa, that too expensive.  Mineral water is salty, similar to sea water. For me I prefer sulfur mineral water. Interior is good design that similar to Japanese style. Landscape is good, detail but not only have small area, not have big scale. This resort is surrounded by mountain, don't have far view  Public sauna area: included but not full sauna types.

1.7 mil VND to 2 mil VND per pax included buffet lunch!  This is definitely not an ideal deal!  However, this place is new, not so crowded so all service and staffs are pretty nice and friendly!  Facilities are very clean! But walking at public onsen area some sharp stone might hurt your feet!  Buffet lunch is a big let down!

I know there aren't many options in Yen Bai in terms of hotel but this was by far the biggest rip off we had in Vietnam. We needed a place to stay on our drive back from Sa Pa to Hanoi and this was the only place we really found. The place was alright in terms of cleanliness but we had NO hot water, the TV was from the early 90's, walls are paper thin, and overall just very unimpressive. This would have been completely fine with us if it was the same rate as all of our other accommodations in Vietnam... but this place was 30 USD A NIGHT!!!!!!!!!!! By FAR the most expensive room we had on our entire trip and we stayed at much nicer places in much nicer cities. Its advertised online for 12-18USD, and when I told the women at the front desk this, she told me that was from 2003...  all in all horrible experience and the biggest rip off of our entire trip.

Huge ugly building with no personality. Cheap is all it has going for it! Beds hard, bathrooms rudimentary, air con overworked and noisy. Food is basic with no English spoken but manageable communication can be had if you have time. Plenty of places on the street for good cheap local food. ( choose a crowded place) Little bar next door sells cheap cocktails which, as there is not much happening, is a " must do" . Bars with lots of plastic chairs selling a "fresh beer" ( bia hoi) around the lake in front of the hotel. Try the bbq squid and smoked dried water buffalo meat which goes well with the beer.

By far and away the worst of my Southeast Asia hotel experiences. Spartan accommodations---I understand that we were in the hinterlands. The bed was little more than a plywood plank with a sheet. Sheet was clean at least. Room was not. The roaches were having a great time. My room had electric which is more than some of our team members had. The bathroom had the wall shower spray which got everything wet including the toilet paper. To be expected perhaps. Breakfast consisted of a few scraps of bread and some sort of gruel. No coffee. Managed to find some edible food at the food stall across the street. We were on a medical mission and had to spend three nights here. I am a fairly seasoned Asia traveler. I don't expect the Ritz Carlton. But the roach motel is hard to take after  12 hours outdoors doing medical work.

h_title_comment: Most comfortable hotel in Tam Dao
h_comment: In this small hill commune with rice fields and vegetable gardens, the last thing one would expect would be a classy, designer hotel as the Ciao Bella.  A 3 level, 7 room abode as close to what you would consider as private, new world and avant garde/bohemian in design.  You will meet a very friendly owner who makes you feel very at home. The hotel comes with immaculately furnished rooms, clean, with large LED tvs, fantastic marble-tiled bathroom, (rainshowers) and lovely view of the countryside outside. The room rate was 1 million Vietnam dong which  I was  very happy to pay.
